meanings.definition: Not able to be built or constructed.
meanings.sent1: The steep cliff was unbuildable due to its unstable foundation.
meanings.sent2: The old, crumbling house was deemed unbuildable by the engineers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to build a sandcastle on the unbuildable beach was like trying to catch a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The unbuildable relationship between the two countries seemed destined to remain fractured.
meanings.sent5: The architect quickly realized the unbuildable nature of the swampy land.

meanings.sent1: The contaminated land was unbuildable and posed a risk to any construction.
meanings.sent2: The dense forest was considered unbuildable due to its protected status.
meanings.sent3: Trying to construct a skyscraper on the unbuildable marshland would be a disaster waiting to happen.
meanings.sent4: The unbuildable terrain proved to be a formidable obstacle for the developers.
meanings.sent5: The unbuildable plot of land was left untouched for years due to its environmental sensitivity.
